creator: albie@alfarrabio.di.uminho.pt
text:
The problem is that sleepycat has two different API's for DB4. I think db4.1.x
is different from db4.0.x, and as I have a db4.1.x version, apr doesn't build.

Thanks.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
The workaround, until somebody adds logic to detect
that version of the library and handle accordingly,
is to add

  --without-berkeley-db

to your configure invocation.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text: *** Bug 14694 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
I just realized that this was fixed in apr-util a while back, but after the
Apache 2.0.43 (if only I had checked before installing db 4.1 :) ).

This patch would seem to be sufficient to get apr-util to work with db 4.1:

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/apr-util/dbm/apr_dbm_berkeleydb.c.diff?r1=1.18&r2=1.19&diff_format=h

Thanks for using Apache!
*** Bug 15204 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: trawick@apache.org
